16oz can thanks to raiders707. Pours a hazy golden orange color with a thin white head. Big juicy tropical and citrus fruit aroma, with caramel malt as well. Damn that's good! Very piny up front, citrus in the middle, and more pine and caramel malt in the finish! Delicious
Bottle From kyle, thanks! Pours clear amber with a floral and citrus hop aroma.  Taste is very nice.. end of the night notes..
Can from Jcwatts. Pours orange gold. White head. Nice lacing. Nose and taste of fresh pineapple, bready malt, resin, tropical fruit, perfume and caramel malt. Medium body. Drying finish.

can, from Jubitation spirits Albuquerque. Good aroma, sweet. fruity, citrusy, apricot, mango. Clean copper color, good head and lace. Bitter sweet flavor. medium body, oily creamy mouthfeel, bitter finish. good brew, was that much better on tap at brewery,  aroma has alot going on, flavor bit more one sided, can was bought cold, brought home in suitcase and  chilled again. still darn tasty
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text:
Wow, this is an incredible IPA. Nuanced. Beautiful -- just beautiful -- malt base, solid with some sweetness, and hops over that in perfect balance. I'm getting a bit of grapefruit, a bit of pine, and just enough bitterness. This is my first Cumbre; I get It. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This came in a can and sampled at the pre-Dark Lord bottle/can/growler sharing at the Hampton Inn.  Poured a dark orange with a nice white head.  Nose is huge hops with citrus, pine, and tropical fruit.  Medium body with a resinous mouthfeel.  Flavor is intense with hops and malts in good balance, and the finish is long and dry and bitter. Wonderful beer.
This one plants you over the head with an absolutely stagering citrus and resiny aroma. Flavor follows, a dry, resinous, delightfully hoppy IPA.
Sampled at the Hampton.  Clear gold copper with a ring.  Big dry bitter hops all over this one.  But they dont eat your face off.  Just right.  Floral and fruit.  Light malts.  Good!

This was my entry into IPAs.  Great beer.  Pine and citrus aroma with a golden/pale color and frothy white/tan head.  Tastes slightly sweet upfront with a short bitter finish.  Overall, this is one of my favorite IPAs so far in the few I have had.

Can sample at a tasting at the new Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks DSG. Pours yellow to orange with a small head, aroma of cheese, herbs, lemon, lemon skin, flavor of grass, lemon skin, very bitter, tasty, medium to full bodied, great

Can from Hopscotch and served in my GI IPA Tulip: Coppery golden hue with a pretty good but fading head, okay lace. The aroma has notes of pine, resin, dank, pineapple, grapefruit, mango, pepper, biscuity and caramel malts with a bit of aspirin and metal. The taste is rather bitter with some citrus backed by some sweet caramel and dry pale grains. Hint of hop spice, garlic, green onions and a bit of tea-baggy astringency. Lively and aggressive mouth feel with a tinny aftertaste. Hint of brash alcohol. Overall it is a very solid brew but not quite all that IMO. The hop bitterness seems a bit raw and too high alpha acid for the refreshment I required.

Amber pour, almost orange. Medium head with little to no lacing. Malty aroma. Bitter front, middle, and end. Hoppy front and middle. Brief hint of sweetness at end that is quickly consumed by bitterness. Tastes woody, lightly roasted, of evergreens. Solid IPA.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 16-oz can from trade with Eric - thanks bud! Slightly hazy rich gold/orange pour with a fluffy white head. Huge hop aroma of pine resin - somewhat dank. Crisp palate from the carbonation and dry hop bite. Taste is bold resin hops, and a little citrus sweetness. Great brew!

Can sample at a tasting at the new Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks DSG. Cloudy amber with white film. Green, grass, rain and nettle aroma, dry, green, bitter taste with some chalk and grass. Delicate carbonation, medium body, green finish with some nettle.

Pours a slightly murky classic golden color with a small, pure white head. Nice bouquet consisting of citrus, grass, and a little pine. Mouthfeel is wet, yet cottony. Very smooth. Very nice, unobtrusive, yet hop-heavy, but still well-balanced IPA. Very drinkable for a 7.2 IPA. Thanks to my hookup in Texas for sending me this one!

Copper color with a small head.  Strong aroma of pine and resin.  Light citrus and biscuit as well as some dankness after warming.  Grassy and tobacco flavor.  Fairly vegetal.  Moderate to strong bitterness.  Bone dry.

Can:  Pale copper pour with a light haze, creamy sand color head.  Nice thick lacing.  Sweet aroma of citrus and caramel, a little piney too.  The taste is where this beer comes through for me.  Very flavorful hops.  Mostly florals, but pine and citrus swirls around too.  Malt stays in the background and it finishes very well.  Smooth throughout, seemless comes to mind.  Scoots well past very enjoyable and right to excellence.

Can shared at a tasting at the new Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks Ruben for this can! Hazy orange with a bubbly white head. Hoppy aroma with lots of tropical fruits and some weed. Very bitter flavor, hoppy, fruity and piney. Medium-bodied. A wonderful IPA.

16oz can with an apparent can date of 12/3/12? Thanks a lot to GHB for sending this my way. Orange color, great head, sticky lacing. Smells like pine, pungent, dank, stanky good. Flavor is bitter, citrus, lemon, a hint of malt. Overall, very solid hop bomb and is really right up my alley as far as IPAs go. I might even say this is west coast style but Im not sure, Im no expert.

Serving type: can

12-14-2012 03:18:32

Can shared by tfurg.  Clean sharp gold pour with one finger of white head.  Sticky nose, super zesty and resinous.  A light onion/garlic component shows as well.  Very fresh and fruity with a super dry and zesty palate.  Light bodied with an established bitterness.

Canned. shared at Kickbacks for RBWG welcome dinner 
Clear gold with a white head.
Grapefruit hop aroma.
Assertive bitterness from start to finish.
Very solid IPA.

The perfect IPA. A new player in the best IPA in America.  Well balanced, perfect hop flavor. 

MKH---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pint cans, RBWG, thanks Erway for brewing and sending these!  Pours a hazy yellow orange with a steady fizzy white head, good lace throughout.  I really like this beer.  Its less aggressive than many of the tasty ipas coming out these days, but the nose and flavor are still right where I want them to be.  Lots of citrus, floral, light tropical notes.   Very nice balance that leans on the hoppy side but as I said, not as aggressive and has a nice soft carbonation.  Lovely.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2014 Can from RBWG. Pours a clear copper from the can with fluffy off-white head that dissipates to leave thin lace. Aroma of funky west coast hops, piney and resinous, catty. Taste follows, but more mellow as you drink more and a drinkable balance. Mellow carbonation, no real bitterness, but still really hoppy, good stuff.
16 ounce can. Thanks Tom!  Pours a clear orange/gold with a nice white head.  Aroma of citrus, pine, and grass.  Taste is grapefruit, oranges, lemons, pine, spices, and caramel.  A very nice IPA!
16 oz can to taster at RBWG. Looks good; orange with sticky white lacing. Smells and tastes good too; nicely hopped with citrus notes. Good on the palate. An excellent example of the style.
Very dank juicy grapefruit IPA here.  Finishes with strong bitterness and pine sap and some citrus.  Great flavorful IPA.

Picked up a can in a trade; poured into a tulip glass.  Hazy orange color with medium to large head.  Nose is hops, citrus, fruit; taste is balanced sweet fruit and bitter hops, with some malt.  Medium bodied.  Surprisingly very good.

Pours a golden colour with good white lacing. Aroma is out of this world one of the most floral beers I have had. It smells of lavender and rose great smelling beer. Taste of lavender, rose, orange, grapefruit. This is a very nice beer. Thanks to Tim at Pinocchio's, Media PA for letting us tap into his personal stash! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bug thanks to Eric! Huge Danky beer, bitterfinizh and slightly malty body, love it thanks man!

Thanks, Aaron! Nice orange/amber pour with a finger of beige head and sticky lacing. Fresh grapefruit and tangerine hop aromas. Sweet bread, floral hops, and pine. The flavor is moderately bitter with some pine and citrus peel notes. Nice grapefruit and tangerine, floral hops, bread, and a strong pine finish. Really nice stuff!

16oz can from Trukpro!  Pours a crystal clear copper color with an eggshell head. Aroma has some dank hops along with some citrus and tropical notes and finally some pine.  Taste is sweet with a pretty strong malt backbone and some juicy citrus hops.  Medium bodied with the carbonation pricking the tongue. The finish becomes gradually more bitter with some light herbal notes that linger.  Pretty stellar IPA.

pint can as a nice extra from my buddy deftim. thanks, tim! pours a clear, pale gold capped by a fluffy, dense white head that leaves soapy rings of lace. aroma is great with big citrus notes of lemon zest, oranges, limes, and white grapefruit backed by pine resins, grass, and subtle, sweet florals. flavor is absolutely excellent with a blast of tangerine, grapefruit, lemon, and pear skins up front backed by a hefty dose of bitter hop resins, grass, herbs, and biscuits. palate is medium bodied with smooth carbonation and a great, dry, bitter finish. overall, a definite world class ipa and i dig the pint can.

Can.  Thanks to adnielsen for sending.  Pours a orange color with white head.  Big, fresh hop, citrus, pineapple aromas.  Citrus, piney, resiny, hoppy flavors.  Along with Bells Two Hearted, this is one of the best IPAs Ive had.  Balanced, with a really nice hoppy flavor, but not too hoppy.

Served out of large sized can into a glass. Sold in a 4 pack with canning date stickered on the top. Pours a dark honey color with a creamy head. Smell is hops, hops, hops. Taste is hops. Bitter and citrus but smooth and balanced. I notice also a small amount of pepper/spice. There is probably malt in here but it will be a moment before the hops wears off. After that happens a delicious malt comes to the fore. This is a delicious beer and it has a respectable alcohol content so makes for a nice, long drink.
Can thanks to Justin. Big pine nose. Lots of aroma. Taste is hops, grapefruit, slight honey sweetness. This pretty much lives up to reputation. Very good.

4 Cans from my man Sam (ketchepillar) 

Pours a bright orangish golden with a big head and lots of nice lacing on the glass.

The aroma has a lot of fresh hop character, citrus, melon (fruit forward hops) and some nice mild spicy hops as well. 

The flavor is spicy and plenty bitter with a mild touch of malt toastiness. Loads of Melon and citrus rind hoppness are the primary focus of the flavor. A light piney character is there as well. The beer is markedly dry and wholly delicious.

Wonderfully resiny. Drinking straight from the can its great! I feel like Im camping kinda. Caramel backbone to hold up this strong hop presence. If you can not get this beer. Find someone who can. Its up there with the best.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2015 4 pack of cans from the brewery. Hop damn! This is some danknasty brew!  Huge, rich hop profile is all over this with tons of actual hop qualities coming to life rather than just simple bitterness. The malts basically only exist for the hops to do their work. Notes of garlic and pepper go along with the usual citrusy and evergreen suspects. Long lasting, resinous finish. Awesome!!!

four pack from Dicks. Canned on May 18, 2014. 

This is a fantastic IPA. For anyone that wants a hugely bitter and insanely hoppy beer, this is it. The clarity is very nice here with a clear amber body and solid white head. The aroma is dank and insanely hoppy. Lots of grapefruit, a little grass, dank herbs, pineapple and ammonia. The flavor is supremely bitter, almost burning. Lots of grapefruit rind, a little melon, pine and a sharp, distinct bite that lasts throughout the finish. This is an excellent beer, so bitter that I may have trouble finishing more than a couple cans. Still, it accomplishes what La Cumbre promises and it has plenty of delicious aromas and flavor rather than sole bitterness.
En Lata.Dorada-anaranjada con fina carbonatación y buenos encajes.Muy fresca en aromas.Enlatada en diciembre.En boca es muy equilbrada,bien lúpulada con un final seco.Perfecta!!Gracias Eric.
Gold, nice white head. Aroma of dank tropical fruit. Flavor is similar. Very clean finish, some bitterness, just enough malt to back it up. So damn good. Thanks Lenin!

16 oz. can served in a FFF Teku. Big thanks to Jeff(supercolter) for the brew!

A: Pours a dark amber color with a yellowish head forming on the pour. It recedes slowly to a thin ring. Sticky sheets of lace are left down the glass.

S: Light fruity and grass undertones. Candied lemon with a sweet malt backbone.

T: Citrus and pineapple with some grassy undertones. Light bitterness with an accompanying sweet toffee malt. Jammy sweetness and fruitiness as well. Slightly earthy with some minimal scallion.

M: Medium to light bodied with a medium carbonation level. Fruity and grassy finish.

O: Pretty good and easily drinkable. Nose left a little to be desired, but overall it was very good and Im glad something good is coming out of New Mexico.

Serving type: can

Can at ChrisO Holiday Tasting, London - thanks to Henrik (I believe). Pours perfectly clear gold with a fine, white foam head. Big citrusy hop aroma, some piss and pineapple, some orange. Medium sweet flavor with sturdy grass, orange rind. Medium bodied with fine, creamy carbonation. Moderately resinous finish, dry pine, grass, citrus rind. Decent overall, pretty good balance.

Pour out of 16 oz can, big thanks to Aaron for being so generous. Nice slightly hazy orange-yellow pour with nice fluffy tan head, aroma is big dank notes of pine, grass, going into nice grapefruit, orange, lemon, some hints of sweet caramel, and a nice rich piney orange mix finishes it out, very nice.  Taste is a nice mix of grapefruit, orange, some lemon, slight mango, pineapple, hints of pine, grass, slight caramel, finishing with a hint of spice, more hops, more bitterness but never overwhelming.  This is very well done.

Can. Pretty subpar for the category. Smells and tastes like cat piss. Imbalanced, but most IPAs these days are. Unpleasant flavor/aroma profile leading to "over-the-top" hop bitterness. Citrus would have been much better than stinky garlic. Malt presence is clearly subdued to compensate for the ridiculous hop character (which misses the mark).

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2015 Tap @ La Cumbre. Pours a clear, dark orange appearance with a white head. Heavy ganja, resiny, super piney, citrusy hoppy aroma. Its like you are sucking on the fucking hops. Super ganja, piney hoppy, palate wrecking flavor. Tasty. Official beer of the Iowa City 1/10/2013 spongedbob party. (4.2). GABF 2015. Really fucking good as usual (4.2)

Can at ChrisO tasting, thanks to Henrik for what I think is my first beer from NM ! 30/12/12.
Lightly hazed mid amber with a thin off white head that clears to the edge and leaves a small film.
Nose is bitter hops, pine, grapefruit - simple and fresh.
Taste comprises bitter grapefruit, hops, pine, orange pith, touch of sugars.
Medium bodied with soft carbonation leading to a bitter dry finish.
First rate IPA!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle at Chrisos tasting 30/12/12. Light amber gold colour. Big piny resinous aroma. Grapefruit. Relatively low bitterness. Mid carbonation and mod sweet finish. Piny finish.
Can at Chriso tasting new year 2012/13.  Clear gold thin white head. Very hoppy aroma. good. yes tasty grapefruit hoppy beer.

Bottle at Chrisos tasting in London, 121230. Clear golden beer with a nice offwhite head. Hoppy lemongrass aroma, caramel, floral, pineapples, metal notes, peach, herbal notes, pine needles, biscuits, spicy notes. Hoppy flavor, caramel, floral, herbal, citrus, grapefruit, pine needles, some biscuits. Hoppy bitter finish with pineapple, citrus, lemongrass and some floral notes. Good beer.
Can, my last bottle od 3 4packs. Pine, citrus, dank, light toast, resiny hops, pleasant bitterness. Enjoyable.

A Christmas present from my daughter via Beer Jobber. Pours clear amber with a white head. The aroma is bready sweet malts. The flavor has the sweet malt base but then gives way to a huge hop hit. Dry and refreshing, one of the best IPAs ive had in a while.

Clear copper pour, thin soapy off white head and striped sticky lacing .... aroma of piney, rindy and citrusy hops with a light caramel malt ... the taste is pure ibu heaven with lots of piney, rindy and citrusy hops, light caramel malt backbone and a dry, strong bitter hop that just pounds the tongue ... mouthfeel is lightly slick and oily with a long bitter bite ... finishes bitter and dry with a lingering bitter hop bite .... abv hidden well ... everything an ipa should be

16 ounce can from my father in law, poured an orangish copper color with aromas of light pine, huge citrus, a touch of caramel, and some pineapple.  Flavors follow suit where citrus is the main player, light bitter aftertaste, a nice ipa overall.

16 oz can, received as an extra in trade. Thanks! Pours a bright amber color with a creamy white head. Aroma is hoppy, grapefruit, pine, some onion. Medium on the palate with average carbonation. Flavor is sweet, hoppy, pine, citrus, onion, nice malt backbone, with a nice hoppy finish. Very tasty.
can, copper orange pour. fluffy white head. very balanced IPA. Far from a hop bomb, but a nice substantial hop presence. Tea notes, orange marmalade, caramel maltiness. Very flavorful. Enjoyable IPA
16 oz can courtesy of beerjobber.  Is it as good as the ads say?  100 ibus, check, wonderful hop flavor, check, get elevated, check.   really nice IPA in a can and highly recommended.

Draft at the source courtesy of erway, thank you sir!  Hazy golden color, small white head. Aroma has tangerine, tropical fruits, pine. Taste has more fruit, citrus, pine. Nice malt balance, so its not overly aggressive. Delicious.
Excellent IPA. Very fresh. Pours a light, golden yellow, with small head. Hop aroma and very strong, bitter hop flavor, with citrus notes and a bitter finish.

Can poured an amber in color  with a thin coating of white head. Aroma has sweet fruit, light citrus, faint tropics, and some pine. Mouth feel is a solid medium and the carbonation to the lower side. Flavor brings on the citrus, tropical fruit, light pine, mellow creeping bitterness, and some malt towards the finish. Very well rounded with plenty of hops but no dry hop punch.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2013 Can at home. Aroma is top notch - strong grapefruit with some dankness and floral notes. Taste is biting hops with just enough sweet malt balance. .Bitter finish, full mouthfeel. New Mexicoâs best beer.

Thanks to my man Nate for this one!! Poured from can. Hazy orange pour. Nose and flavor bring definite fresh scallion/onion character, nice tangerine and citric notes, touches of vibrant pine, and lemongrass. Fresh, clean, and refreshing. Damn good IPA.

Nice sticky resinous nose, with a touch of cotton candy. Taste is lightly sweetand fairly bitter with lots of sticky hops, pine and citrus, some darkness and light golden fruit. Finishes with sweet honey and pithy bitterness.

473mL can straight from the brewery via beerjobber. Canned on 11/26/12. Hmm...not the 12/06/12 batch... Pours a clear deeper orange. Medium, rocky, buttermilk foam. Excellent, hop oil laden retention. Decent lacing. Nose is tangerine, candies, lemon verbana, still a bit sticky with hints of lemon cleaner/chemical. Taste is sticky, chewy, tangerine, orange. Decent malt and hop playoff but still on the richer, malty side minus the tea astringency, which is nice. Up front some decent chewy maltiness, even rustic huskiness. Mid shows some body and spicy alcohol. Finish is quick, bitter, fairly soft. No lingering soapiness or tea tannic astringency. Nice, simple, for the "West Coast" more malty than expected. Very similar to Bells Two Hearted. Not a dry hop showcase. Lacks quenching butterscotch and pineapple of Alpine Duet and Alesmith IPA. Filling, heavy body.

Canned 12/3/12 from beerjobber.  Pours copper in color with a thinnish white head.  Aroma is resinous pine with balanced bitterness and perhaps some citrus followed by a bready malt backbone that is extremely clean but not too much so that its biting.  Taste is a harmonious balance of pine, bitterness, and perhaps one the best malt backbones Ive had in an IPA since the last time I was at Alpine - amazing balance of fresh biscuity malt that has just enough sweetness to counterbalance the bitterness but in no way detracts from the hop glory.  Clean, soft mouthfeel.  Damn impressive and then some!

16 oz can from Beerjobber. Pours a translucent copper color with a small off-white head that recedes to a film. The aroma is medium in strength with ripe citrus. The flavor, like the nose, is a big blast of citrus; lots or oranges, grapefruit and some mango too. The malt base is lightly bready and suits the hops well. The palate is full and silky smooth with lively carbonation. Finishes long and bitter with lingering resins. Overall: Very tasty, much enjoyed--thanks erway.

Draft at the brewpub. Pours a clear gold color with a small white head. Explosive hop aroma- herbal, piney, oily- with some pale malts. Comes together like weed. Flavor of oily, herbal, resinous hops, pine resin, and pale and sweet malts. Light body, medium carbonation, and a bitter, coating mouthfeel. Giddy up. This west coast-style IPA brings it.
Great smell to this one, they arent lying about the hopiness. The flavor is just as aggressive, feels like a hop punch. Bitterness lingers a bit. Overall, a great beer.

I'm not sure what to say. Poured out of the cool tall can, it is a lovely orange color. I'm just about finished with my third (aren't Friday nights great?), but I can't decide if I like it or love it. My UPS delivery of this beer was really cool, so that adds to the positive vibe

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
can @ salone del gusto (papazian event). It pours with a good head on top. Good bitterness, very spicy. Great beer.

Now, Im not a super IPA fan, but Im working towards it and this beer sure helps. Pours an orange amber with a 2 finger off white foam. The foam dies down but that hoppy aroma sure doesnt. Resiny, citrus, and appealing. Medium body has a thick hop bitterness. Body supports well without sweetness. Finish is dry, clean, and very smooth. This is outstanding.

Can courtesy if mike. Thanks! Pours orange light amber color with off white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is awesome. Bitter citrus, a touch of garlic, sweet malt in there, and more bitterness. Medium mouthfeel. Flavor is ultra smooth. Bitter citrus resinous hops balanced by sweet caramel malt. This is an awesome brew. Thanks again mike!

Pours a clear golden/orange with a large off white head...nice lacing.  Aroma is a bit subtle but has melon and rind...a bit skunky in a good way.  Flavor has melon and kiwi notes with some earthy bitterness...touch of hoppy spice.  Mouthfeel is light/medium and silky with a melon/earthy/bitter finish.  This is more of a subtle but very well crafted IPA.  Enjoyable and very drinkable.
16 oz - Big perfumey nose, same thing on palate. Sufficiently dry, lots going on, love the cans.

This is what a real IPA should taste like.....100 IBU and 7.2 ABV. This hangs with and exceeds just about any good IPA from the Pacific Northwest and the Gold Medal at the GABF in 2011 talks the talk and certainly walks the walk. New Mexico craft brews have come a long way and are now held to the same standards and competing with those from Colorado, California, Oregon, and Washington. There are many good IPAs out there, but Im convinced this is there best around for American Style.

16oz CaN .. . Pours a light cloudy gold pear .. . mild foam .. . wow, this is the most watery beer in history.. . mild hops .. . about as exciting as stubbing your toe 

.. . . Im a 10-year-old fraud!

16 oz can poured a hazy orange amber with a lasting ivory head. Aromas of biscuit, cat piss, earthiness, skunk bud, grapefruit, tangerine and light tropical fruit. Palate was medium bodied and crisp with a smooth dry finish. Flavors of biscuit, skunk bud, earthiness, grapefruit and pine with a smooth dry bitter lingering grapefruit finish.
Pine and floral hops.  Sweet malt with hoppy finish.  Deep cold and thin pillowy persistent head.  Solid west coast style hop bomb.

Sample at GABF 10/13/2012, thanks to Bluemeow76 for assistance with note-taking. Slightly hazy orange-amber color with a medium ivory white head and strings of lacing. Citrus, hops and malt in the nose. Medium-bodied with a citrusy hops character and notes of herbs and bready malt. The finish is moderately bitter with a hoppy aftertaste. Above average overall.

Pour from a tallboy at GABF 12. Appearance is golden orange with a big white head and good lacing. Big weed, pine, resin, light straw, and citrus in the aroma. Taste follows the aroma with dank notes of weed, ganja, pine, biscuit, and straw with a medium bitter finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Pretty good, but is really lacking a solid malt backbone, and I think it would realy benefit from some added caramel notes. Still pretty tasty stuff.

canned, from trukpro in trade, bright orange color with creamy foam, another nice IPA from these guys, good citrus aroma with a bit of caramel malt, flavor is quite smooth, malty pines, some sticky citrus, nice beer
Gift from BC4M. Thanks! Citrusy herbal hop aromas. Citrusy hop flavors showing tangerine and lemon zest. Finishes clean and dry. Overall a very tasty IPA.

Growler pour at Dans.  Straw colored, small head.  Aroma is floral, tropical, and sweet.  Somewhat hoppy flavor, very easy drinking.  This was a bit flat, but from a growler I cant complain.  Nice beer.

16oz can from Trukpro, thanks Dude! Pours out a very attractive amber/copper color with a decent white head. Aroma at first is vegetal and somewhat off putting, then as it warms it becomes very nice; notes of fruity citrus hops, light melon, citrus and light floral sweetness. Taste is of a nice fruity citrus hop note with light tropical fruit, melon, floral notes, sweet but not overly so in the background with a dry, bitter finish. Pretty solid.

16oz tal boy shared by Pineypower, thanks Dean. Poured a dark hazy amber/orange body with a foamy piss bubble head. Aroma wasnt that great when it was cold but as it warmed it defientely got better. Notes of cat piss, soapy dish water, earth, caramel and some citrusy hops with warmth. Flavor is better then the aroma and also improves with warming, fruity overall with notes of pineapple, apricot, tangerine, orange marmalade, toast crusts, rapefruit rind. The body is dry and full with stronger carbonation, finishes dry and bitter. Good beer but warm this bitch up.

This poured a darker yellow to orange color with a white head.  Aroma was nice grapefruit and tropical fruit, some dankness to with light caramel notes.  Flavor was a little candy sweetness, with a nice amount of floral and tropical notes. Good but not great.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2015 Tap at Cowgirls in Santa Fe 8/15/2012
I didnt know about this one before trying it, making the experience all the better for its unexpectedness. Brilliant IPA, tangerine peel augmented with dank deliciousness. The alcohol is apparent in the mouthfeel, but in a fully-bodied way rather than a hot one. Delicious, delicious beer and a total stunner to come of Albuquerque without any advance expectatoins. 

Revisit: multiple drafts at Hotel Santa Fe Dec 2014-Jan 2015. Rich amber pour, head that sticks to the sides of the glass. Dank aroma as before, lots of citrus peel. Old school done right. Massive hop flavor and full body, herb and menthol; better for sipping than crushing. Hop oils are very strong on the close like some of the older IPAs, perhaps detracting slightly from the overall enjoyment of the beer. Still pretty impressive and miles ahead of the Santa Fe Pale that serves as its main alternative here. Id go more like 3.8 or 3.9 on this one after drinking many pints over the course of this trip, but Im going to let the original 4.1 stand because the delight of finding this out of the blue was genuine. 

tl;dr summary: This under-the-radar IPA nearly deserves its 100/100 rating!

Can. Big thanks to Trukpro for these jewels. Pours burnt orange and almost the the color of Indiana aged clover honey. Spicey hops all over the front end with mixed citrus brightness, oranges, grapefruit, pines, resinous oils, sweet fruitiness accented by sweeter caramel malts. Flavor is hop forward with sweet malt flavors, with a dry medium body moderately bitter finish. Medium warming character. fantastic beer.
On tap.  A solid IPA with hops all around.  Strong hop aroma with ample piney/citrus/catty.  Full flavor with great hop bitterness and balance finishing perfect.  I love IPA, and love this beer!

Can... Lightly hazed yellow ale with golden highlights and a small, creamy, white head. Good retention. The aroma provides big Simcoe hops - earthy, musky and pissy. Full-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and tingly carbonation. The flavor presents a heavy level of citrusy, grapefruity, musky bitterness. Lengthy, bitter finish.

Pours a hazy gold, aroma of dank resinous hops, citrus and pine. Taste follows, not as bitter as the nose, a bit too sweet for my liking. Not as good as I expected. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
First a growler then tap now can. Not the same. Beer seems to be declining in quality.
Hazy yellow with a white head.  Nose is sticky fruits, sweat, spices, and earth.  Nice palate, thick, sticky hops, heavy fruits, and a nice finish.
(16oz can) clear gold, sparse offwhite bubbles. Nose of onion, spicy, bit of lemon, umami. Taste of lemon, bit malty, spicy, mild bitterness, low citrus presence, spicy linger, well carbonated.

Pours a nice amber color and has a tall frothy lasting head. Scent is a little light on pine and some caramel. Taste is big hop flavors, lots of pine and grapefruit, super smooth IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2012 Amazing.  Cloudy hazy orange gold pour with decent head and great retention and lacing.  Nose of all types of hops, citrus, and other fruit.  Taste is sweet and fruity with plenty of hops and a nice sweet malt backbone.  This would hold its own against most great IIPAs but as a Single IPA and only 7.2% I am not sure there are many better.  Certainly worthy of GABF gold in 2011.  My opinion may be a little slanted in that I was enjoying copius Qtys of this in 95 degree weather while on a lake in New Mexico.  Many things may taste that good in the heat on vacation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From the can pours a deep orange with a foamy head. Really earthy and resinous hop aroma. Orange peel, pine, very earthy hop presence with a full mouthfeel makes this just so easy to drink.

7/13/12. My first rating at my new house in Jacksonville! ...and a delicious one at that! I drank about half the 16oz can (provided by hopscotch!) before I decided to rate it. Slightly hazed dark orange pour with a nice khaki head that sticks. Not a ton of lacing, but I had rinsed my glass before pouring. Complex hoppy aroma with floral aspects, citrus, bitterness, and a nice malt backing of sweet caramels and a grainy aspect that reminds me of pils malt. Slightly sweet grapefruit entry with lots of citrus and some floral aspects. Sweet sugars arrive next with some sweet caramel from the nice malt backing. Lingering dryness and floral aspects. Nice!

16 oz can. Thanks trukpro! It pours a nice clear golden color with a small off white head. It has a very complex hoppy aroma of pine, spice, light melon and tropical fruit with a touch of toasty malt. The flavor is intense with dense spicy hops cat pee, pine, smooth malt character and a biting, spicy finish. There are some hints of tropical fruit and dank as well. The mouthfeel full and the carbonation is a bit low. I would not call this a "citrusy" IPA, but it is very tasty nonetheless. Well done.

Best IPA I've ever had. Hands down! I'm new to rate beer, but not IPAs. This is so well balanced and complex.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can thanks to trukpro!  Clear dark orange pour, a little lacing in the center and an arom of bitter orange hops and honey.  Flavor is bitters, orange zest, sweet biting pine, dry hops and finished clean with a warming on the aftertaste.  Nice beer all around, will be looking for more of this!

Growler.  Clear ,golden orange color with tiny white head.  Tropical fruit fills the nose.  Its like some fucking starbursts filling my nasal cavities.  Taste is mango, slight orange, grapefruit, pineapple, and slight pine.  Fuck me, this is delicious.  Medium bodied.  Love this.  I need more of this.

Growler from the brewery. Pours a nice golden orange color with a white head. Aroma is filled with sweet citrus fruits, orange, tangerine, some grapefruit, peach and tropical fruits. The flavor follows the nose and is super fresh, as I say, fresh squeezed hop juice. I get, tropical fruits like mango and pineapple, and orange, tangerine and peach. The body is medium with a dry mouth feel. Overall an amazing IPA, this one surprised me!

On draught at Geckos. Pours a clear dark gold color. Hoppy aromas hit first. Medium body with intense hop bitterness. Hop flavors dominate. Slight citrusy character but not one-dimentional. Slightly sweet underlying maltiness. An impressive IPA.

Sampled March 2011; RBWG
The beer pours from the growler with a pale tan head that sits on top of a clear, copper hued beer that shows a brightness when held up to the light. There is a really, dank hop character to the nose that is a mix of tropical and citrus fruit and hemp oil.  The nose is just so dank and juicy; specific notes of tangelo, a bit lychee character, mango, a hint of menthol, and just a really big hemp like character is found here. There is a touch of supporting malt character that provides hints of a cracker like whole grain character.

The beer is lightly sweet and has a fair amount of a crystal malt backbone to it. The hop character is of course the dominant note in the flavor, with a nicely herbal character, lots of hop-fruit, a firm bitterness (that is not over the top), lots of pine notes, a firm herbaceous hemp-seed like flavor, and rounding notes of lychee and even some mango are noticeable here.

This is nice and dankly fresh. I like how light and quaffable this is, as that is really what I want in an IPA. The flavor doesnt quite live up to the promise of the aroma, but this is still something I am quite happy to be drinking.

On tap at ONiells.  Small white head, rich golden color.  Powerful hoppy citrus aroma.  Nice bitter flavor, with a touch of citrus.  Remarkably similar in profile to another local IPA by Marble.  Very enjoyable.
(Draught)  Pours a lightly hazy golden body with a medium off-white head.  Aroma of dank, herbs, caramel, and pine.  Flavor of resin, grass, pine, some citrus, and caramel with a dry, bitter finish.

Several pours from a growler generously shared by csbosox, who picked this up at the brewery approximately 10 days ago. The pour is copper orange ruby with a smallish off white head. Nice lacing left as the beer falls. The aroma is resin, catty, slightly dank, hint of pine, some cracker malt and a nice mineral note in the finish. The taste is big resin right away, great dank bitterness, toasted malt, quite dry in the finish with a great mineral after taste. The palate is medium bodied, a lower carbonation level, and the dry crisp finish.  Thanks a ton Chris for bringing this back and sharing, I have been wanting to try a La Cumbre beer since they started up.  I would love to try this fresh at the source, even after 10 days in a growler this was great.

Courtesy of ketchepillar at the Black Friday Tasting, thanks Sam, pouring up clear deep gold with an off white head. The aroma offers up rich citrus goodness with a nice supporting layer of malty sweetness in the background. Smells of pure YUM. The taste has firm bitter and flavor citrus hops rolling into modest levels of sweet maltiness. The citrus hops are just rich and vibrant and nicely sweetened up by the maltiness. This is crisp and yummy and amazing stuff. I could drink a ton of this. This is one of those beers that starts off amazing and somehow gets even better the more you drink.
Poured a copper in color with a white head.  Nice hoppy-piney taste and aroma.

Draft at GABF. I can see how this one was a winner, though its not my first choice in terms of style. Pours an attractive copper hued gold with a nice head. Nose is very fragrant and clean. Lots of citrusy notes and a hint of caramel. On tasting, its got a nice bitterness that pushes it to the good side for an IPA. Light caramel notes come through with the citrus and it finishes quite dry. Really great IPA overall.

Draft.  Hazy copper in color with a well-formed white head.  The aroma is awesome - a huge hop blast with citrus, pine, resin, and sweet malt.  The flavor is excellent.  Bready malt base with a dank, citrusy, piney hop attack in yo face.  Really great.  Medium-bodied and enamel-ripping with a good carbonation level.  One hell of an IPA from out of nowhere.  Deserved its GABF gold medal.

Hazy amber.  Big hop aroma is earthy.  A bit cheesy, too.  Medium hops, earthy.  Clean pale malt sweetness is good.  The funny thing about this is that it does hit the right notes...and you can drink a lot of it.  Theres no one thing that makes it, but it ends up being a damn good IPA.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2013 hazed bright golden orange.  dense hop oil nose, more resinous than fruity but with accompanying bright yeast esters.  medium body, bit astringent and resinous but not excessive.  bright, snappy, sharp hop acids.   superbly drinkable.

@ ABQ brewfest. Warm coppery gold with slight haze. Cask-natural head. Big aroma is more 2IPA than IPA. Smells chewy and like five different hops at once: some earthy, some piney, some citrusy, some astringent and resinous. Also has a great big malt backbone. On the chewy side but great.

Fresh growler courtesy of GabeM, thanks buddy! this stuff is terrific. its super fruity, not that bitter, and drinks way too easy. not only are there tons of citrus fruits in here, but also rip red berries, blamble berries, and loads of tropical fruits. this is what i would expect froma good carribbean brewer for drinking while sitting on the beach closer to the equator. great stuff.

sample at GABF on 9/30/11. golden pour with small white head.  big citrus hop nose. medium body with lots of citrus hops throughout. light malt background. big dank bitter finish. deserves the medal they got.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2011 OK, I believe the owner of this brewery has specifically said he does not his beer rated at festivals, specifically in small, one ounce pours like at the GABF. Cool, I understand that, but I couldnt resist. Sure, it was a small pour. And it was 3 hours in, so I was a little buzzed. Still - worth the hype. Get some. Trust me on this.

On tap, multiple samples and GABF. Pours a clear bright yellow to light orange hue with a medium sized white head. Aromas are extremely dank with an over ripe fruit aroma that I associate with CTZ. Dank, fruity pungent and herbaceous. Flavors have some dry hop grassiness to them. Very dry, fruity dank, overripe (CTZ) character. Very light malt character but a pleasant bitter balance overall (no harsh bitterness, only harshness is the light grassy character). Very dry (good), medium bubbles. Very tasty!

Orange pour with creamy white head and lace. Citrus, bread and a hint of resin on the aroma. Large citrus, bread, resiny with long lingering bitter. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Very nice beer.

On tap at the brewpub.  Pours a clear light orange with a thick white head.  Aroma is super piney and resiny with some citrus.  Uber inviting!  Flavor of citrus and pine predominantly, also some lime.  Lots of resin and bitterness.  Definitely an IPA geared for a hophead.  My favorite La Cumbre beer of the bunch.
8/4/8/4/15 [3.9/5]
on tap-pours an off white head and yellow color.  Aroma is sweet pine/resin, some light/medium malt.  Taste is sweet pine/resin hops bite, some light/medium malt.  Good effervescence.

Growler thanks to Eric, this was without a doubt one of the best beers of the weekend to me, and one of the best IPAs I have ever had.  Pours light amber with a medium off white head.  Aroma is so dank with tons of hops all over the place, pine, citrus, grassy, herbal.  Flavor is very assertive hop wise, but balanced in a way that is dangerously drinkable.  Dry in the finish.  I want this stuff in IV form!

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2013 tap at brewpub and growler at RBWG-I Finally get to rate my friend Jeff Erways beers now.  all the guys from the RBWG have been giving me shit for not getting to my ratings.  Well, sitting here in my hotel room in shitty Barstow, CA i finally have the time to input my ratings.  pours bright orange with a small soaphy hiead and good lacing.  citric, floral, flower nose with some tropic notes as well.  flavors are much more in the resin/piney side, almost palate ripping bitterness here.  I like this type of IPA more than the citric based (sweet floral and litely bitter).  big grapefruit and leafy hops on the finish-almost has that "green" flavor going on.  Looooooooong Dry finish-almost to try.  my palate was wrecked after this!  glad i had this one last in their lineup.  Great!

Bottle from a tradae with ketchepiller. Pours clear orangish amber color with off white head. Strong citrus aroma with some floral hops. Citrus and pine flavors with a hint of sweetness. Medium body withaverage caebonation. A really nice IPA, wish I could get this locally. Thanks Sam.

On tap at La Cumbre many many times. The best part about this beer is that its still improving; almost every batch is better than the last. Aroma-really fresh, citrusy and floral hops. The hop character is mainly light citrus, floral, some dankness. No resin or dish soap, which is good for me. Body is pretty close to spot on. I may like it a touch drier. Top notch IPA.
Growler pour. Clear amber color/ ivory head. Big fresh ganja bud, pine, floral hoppy aromas. medium bodied. Very nice pine, tropical fruit flavors on a solid caramel base--
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Growler pour at RBWG 2011. Pours clear orange, thin off-white head, spotty lacing. Nose is grapefruit, mandarin orange rind, apricots, BIG spice and pine notes. I really love how this smells. Flavours of sweet mandarin and nectarine, perfect bitterness. This is a lovely, spicy, juicy IPA, again, this is an IPA that feels custom-tailored to my wants. Also, considering this was a growler pour, that this gets a 5 for palate is doubly astounding. I must get down to New Mexico to try out the rest of the line from these folks!
Golden brown color with a white head.  Very floral hoppy aroma.  Floral and piney with a sappy sweet flavor.  Clean hoppy mouthfeel and a warm dry finish.
FIRE IT UP! Gold pour, white head.  Nice straight forward piney, citrus peel balanced IPA.  Love the hops and the malt is really well done.

Growler shared by Terminus during a RBWG stop at the Az Wine Co for some great food and beers 
Appearance: Clear golden with a medium sized white head and good lacing 
Aroma: Floral and pine 
Taste: Floral and pine with some light bitterness  
A nice IPA, well balanced and clean.

Growler shared by Terminus during RBWG - Pours a copper color with a small off white head.  Light lacing.  Aroma is a wonderful collection of PNW hops.  Flavor was loaded with the fore mentioned hops and just enough malt to showcase the hops.  Nice, clean finish.  Medium body.  Another personal RBWG highlight for me.  Thanks Eric and Jeff.

Shared at RBWG, Pours a bright copper color with a medium white head. The aroma is soft herbal and spicy hops, also loads of oranges. The flavor is similar; some toasted malts balance it out, oranges, some spiciness, not overly bitter at all. Tasty, should appeal to a wide audience, geeks and the masses alike.

Tap at brewery. Pours a wonderful glowing golden copper with thin white head. Wonderfully exquisite and powerful aroma of American hops. Notes of citrus, pine, and grapefruit waft out towards the drinker. The aromatic hop profile comes through strong and beautiful in the taste without the overpowering bitterness you would assume from such a well hopped profile. The malts are well subdued, providing just enough sweet backbone to make this beer entirely too easy drinking.  Palate is smooth and silky with a very pleasing bitter aftertaste.  In a country where IPAs have been well overplayed this beer stands up gracefully!

On tap at the brewery. Clear copper with a thin off-white head. Aroma of hops -- citrus, pine, medicinal herbs. The brewer says this is 100 IBUs, yet the flavor is not just an overpowering experience of bitter hops. This brew manages to achieve incredible balance and drinkability. Its malt base is lean and unobtrusive while still providing enough sweetness to stand up to all those hops. Mouthfeel is wonderfully smooth, almost oily. Herbal resins cling to the tongue while a sweet green aftertaste lingers indefinitely. A sublime example of the American IPA style.
